  2. California faces ‘profound increased risk for valley fever.’ Here’s how it’s connected to weather  San Francisco Chronicle
  3. California droughts may help valley fever spread  Science News Magazine
  4. Public health officials in SLO County say Valley fever cases on the rise again  KSBY News
  5. California officials warn of increased risk of Valley fever following music festival outbreak  Scripps News
